user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Beautiful colors. Just because the colors aren’t suitable for your skin tone or the fact that it’s not the most pigmented blush formula, doesn’t deny the fact that this product itself is an amazing product. The highlighter aren’t blinding. They’re more of a powder/ creamy formula so using your fingers will be a better option rather than using a brush. They’re more of a blush topper. The blushes are so finely meld. However the colors are natural and soft so it might not show up as well on deeper skin tones. I understand the controversies people have on this pallet. Some people might say that it doesn’t have enough payoff, but to me, the payoff is just enough and it’s so easy to blend bc it’s so buttery. I prefer blushes that aren’t too pigmented bc then it won’t be too much all at once. If anything, just build it up. Also, you’re paying $60 for 6 colors when NARS blushes are $30 EACH. So if you like two of the colors in this limited edition pallet, it’s worth it right?

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Deep', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: This is a gorgeous palette; the blush colors give a great wash of color without being overdone and are buildable. The highlighters are great colors that complement the blushes or can be worn alone. They have a cream texture that is buttery but not heavy on the skin and provide the right balance of glow/shimmer that everyone can enjoy and wear confidently.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
This is my dream face palette. I purchased it initially for the blushes as Nars blushes are some of the best out there but I was shocked by how much I love the highlights! Yes, they are subtle but can easily be built up. You want to use your fingers to apply. The blend and sink into the skin so beautifully! The blushes are gorgeous shades. I apprehensive about the middle blush as these sort of peachy-coral blushes sometimes tend to look fake-tan orange on my medium-neutral skin but instead, it gave me such a natural warmth to my cheeks. This palette is a 10/10 for me. I’m so happy I convinced myself to pick it up for the spring sale after I passed on it during the winter sale!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Another smash hit palette by nars! At this point are we really surprised that this brand has released yet another completely versatile, user friendly and amazing palette. Nars Orgasm started this frenzy among makeup geeks everywhere, and companies have duped it over and over again, and since nars has released multiple successful launches, but they've managed to outdo themselves, once again by introducing their gel to powder formula. This highlighter formula is absolutely stunning, and the best part, anyone can use them, regardless of their makeup skill or their specific taste. The colours are extremely pigmented on the first swatch, but don't seem to pigmented on application, this doesn't make it a bad product in fact it makes it a great one. The new gel to powder formula look stunning, you can go for a subtle application for just a bit of a dewy radiance on the high points of your face or get them to look super intense and blinding. Bear in mind that these highlighters are gel to powder, they do need to be warmed up a little when you first start to use this palette, just use your fingers to get the product to warm up, and become a little loose from its press. Once you get it going these colours all perform beautifully, and the best part about the new highlighter formula is that it doesn't look powdery, and for the oily girls out there since it dries down to a powder it will stay in place all day with being set. its the best of both worlds, and in my opinion is worth the hefty $78 price tag

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Not the easiest to work with
review_content:
I go back and forth with this palette. My skin is a light medium shade with neutral to warm undertones (NC25 if we're going there), so I feel like I shouldn't have an issue with these shades. Some days, if I apply the highlight with a damp sponge, it does look like a beautiful dewy glow. However, I have not been able to pick the highlight up on a brush, and if I apply it on a lighter "no-makeup" day, it can be a visible streak of product. If you are a lighter skintone than I am, I'm not sure how you could make all the shades work. The texture and feel of the blushes is very nice. They are by no means powdery, and they have a slight luminosity with no visible shimmer particles. My issue is that only the far right shade really shows up on my skin, and I don't feel like it's special enough within my collection to justify keeping this palette. With the left and middle blush being too light for me, it's like the opposite issue than the highlighter shades. I think I have to call this a miss for me. I was so excited for these tones... I love cream highlights, and wanted a few new glowy-ish blushes. Although a beautiful result is possible, in the long run I don't think I'll reach for this so I'm gonna return it while I still can.
…read more

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
This is the 1st time one of the Nars face palettes have been 100% for me (I do have previous ones, but none of them like this). The blush tones are gorgeous & pigmented. You can mix them, use the darkest as contour (if you're fairer skin tone); they give the skin a lovely flushed looked. I'm medium Tan skin (think Halle Berry, a smidge fairer) and these shades show up on me. The highlighters really give a "glow from within" look to your skin. I either use a sponge to apply or my Sephora highlighter brush (similar to the ABH one but I adore the Sephora one more). I don't regret this purchase at all & am very happy that I got this; I've been using this everyday since purchased (this is another workhorse face palette, just like the Hourglass Edit palette). For reference, my winter shades are NARS Syracuse / TF BTW in Honey / EL Double Wear in 4W2 / Giorgio Armani Luminous Silk in shade 8 Summer shade from above brands in Tahoe / Caramel / 5N1 or 5N2 /shade #9

user_specs: ['Age 45-54', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I really like this palette. The blushes give a natural look and the highlighters in the top row can be used to amp them up. I have had no issues picking up highlighter product (I use a Rephr 24 bronzer brush and would recommend any tightly packed, dense brush for this purpose) and I put it on before the powder blush. I find the powder sits really nicely and the two products meld together well. If you like blinding/wet highlighter, this is not the product for you. But it does provide a beautiful natural glow with a lot of soft colour options/combos. Took off one star only because of the need to use a fairly specific brush type with the highlighter.

review_content: Nars makes the best blushes hands down. The highlights are best applied with a beauty blender..I personally got them to work with an abh highlight brush and the highlights are so stunning!!

I have a zillion blush pallets but found this one and had to have it. The blush is an interesting formula...it’s almost creamy, but not. The reason I’m giving 4 stars is because you really need to dig your brush in the color over and over to get any on the brush. This is only true with the shimmer colors, whereas the color payoff on the matte colors is easy to apply.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I generally hate blush as I'm always in a constant battle to find some that works for my fair skin. I feel like anything I put on instantly looks way to bright; most often I use light bronzers as blush. I saw one video review that suggested this palette was more suited for fair skin tones, so I was intrigued. This is my first Nars purchase. I don't mind the blushes and I can see myself using them. The problem is the highlighters. They are impossible to apply using a brush. Using your finger to apply them gives them a much more intense, almost metallic highlighter look to them, and that is not something I want for everyday use. This palette is going back, I can't justify the price for 3 highlighters that are practically un-useable.
